message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CG, cs.CV, cs.NA, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses a new sampling theorem on the sphere and its implications for compressed sensing. The focus is on reducing the number of samples required to represent a band-limited signal on the sphere, which is a problem in information theory (cs.IT). The paper also mentions an inpainting problem on the sphere, which involves image processing (cs.CV) and numerical analysis (cs.NA). The new sampling theorem may have applications in computer graphics (cs.CG) and signal processing (cs.SI) as well.
